Name: Renaming one thoroughfare and public place in the Borough of Queens, Seaver Way.
Title: A Local Law in relation to renaming one thoroughfare and public place in the Borough of Queens, Seaver Way, and to amend the official map of the city of New York accordingly

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Parks and Recreation
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Committee approved by Roll Call.
A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
This Introduction was Sent to Mayor by Council
This Introduction was City Charter Rule Adopted
This Introduction was Returned Unsigned by Mayor

Attachments.Name: May 8, 2019 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 8, 2019
June 26, 2019 - Stated Meeting Agenda with Links to Files
Minutes of the Stated Meeting - June 26, 2019
Legislative Documents - Letter to the Mayor

Summary: This bill will rename 126th Street between Northern Boulevard and Roosevelt Avenue, Seaver Way, and amend the official City map accordingly.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1. The following street name, in the Borough of Queens, is hereby renamed as hereafter indicated.

New Name
Present Name
Limits
Seaver Way
126th Street
Between Northern Boulevard and Roosevelt Avenue

	�2. The official map of the city of New York shall be amended in accordance with 

the provisions of sections one and two of this local law.

	�3. This local law shall take effect immediately.





PM
LS # 10070
3/22/19 3:00PM
